snippet: In the last seven years, Citigroup has sold more than 60 businesses, and its holdings have shrunk by $700 billion.
abstract: Citigroup has sold more than 60 businesses and reduced its assets by $700 billion over last seven years; regulators are demanding cuts of this magnitude from big banks, under Dodd-Frank law, so they can build up enough financial cushion to protect themselves in another economic crisis.

byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and MICHAEL CORKERY

lead_paragraph: In the last seven years, Citigroup has sold more than 60 businesses, and its holdings have shrunk by $700 billion.

headline.main: Shrunken Citigroup Illustrates a Trend in Big U.S. Banks
headline.print_headline: Regulations  Enforce a Diet  For Citigroup

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
